comments.body: update 1.4 was the last terraria update... or was it?
That's a terrible joke language... i love it ; - ;
Maybe call it "UwU" instead?
I hate this idea and don't find it funny, Yet, I like this idea and find it funny. UVVU lulxd plz lik and subscrib.
I feel this would make more sense as a resource pack - after all, this is exactly what they're for.
Yes, since Java (PC) players can as many keys as they can at a time, so we also should be able to use at least 3 or 4 fingers at a time in pocket edition (mobile)

If you can buy one emerald for 4 ingots, then you should buy only 2 ingots for an emerald, otherwise you will just buy ingots and then sell them at the same price, losing nothing and leveling the villager.

If you were to do that, there should be some loss.

Anyways, I agree you should be able to buy iron from the villagers.
Sorry I didn't think about the cruelty of iron farms. I thought about how tedious they are to make.

There's no problem with the current ways of gaining iron though, you have to work for the iron if it is building iron golem farms or mining and looting. Also, I think you need to change your moral sense of cruelty lol, killing the iron golems in lava is not cruel, it's in a very child-friendly game called Minecraft. If you don't like it then don't do it, but it's definitely not cruel as they are not real, don't have feelings, and it's inside of a children's game! Just chill they know what they're doing when they made the game lol

This would be a good quality of life change. I'd also say that it would be cool if clocks and compasses weren't hidden when using the boat either since I see them as similar to the map in the way that they are used (looking at them in your hand, that is.)

There should be an option for each user to turn this on and off for themselves in the graphics settings. It's honestly really unsettling, almost in an Unanny Valley sort of way. Minecraft skins are static and were not made to blink. Steve and Alex were not meant to blink in-game.
Good idea. You have my vote!
U can add a repeat command block setting the time to night repeatedly, just make sure you turn show outputs off so it will be always night without pop up messages 1000 times per second
This would be so nice when experimenting with with builds in creative mode to see how your lighting looks, find dark areas and such.
An option to skip the current piece being played would be nice too.
I agree especially when you try and work so hard on a world then u accidentally put cheats on or a sibling and it suck so please help agree and tuen them back on
I think they shouldn't add this because then people can just put stacks of diamonds right in front of them and then turn back on achievements it would break the game entirely

How it should work is that when you turn back achievements it would bring you back to that time period in your world so if you have a stack of diamonds it would bring that save without cheats which would remove that stack
This really, and I mean REALLY, needs to be a feature,

I would love this, even as a game rule!
One of my zoo animals died and I have no idea how, as the enclosure has been safe for months...

I love your idea! While inclusion and diversity should always be one of the main priorities, the terms of blacklist and whitelist have no malicious intent referring to race. I see exactly why it may seem this way, but these terms have been, and likely always will be, widely used by developers, corporations, etc. around the world. By changing such universal concepts, there may be translation errors and widespread confusion as a result. At the end of the day, there is only one race: the human race :) Keep spreading positivity!!!

Another product Microsoft owns, GitHub, has already changed the old naming convention for all new Git repositories from "master" to "main" with this same idea in mind. Malicious intent was probably not intended when it was a societal norm to use these sorts of terms. It is not acceptable now and most communities in software development are changing their tune. It's also a much more semantic naming convention to name the files as OP suggests with allowlist and denylist, even for the file names.
+1 let's see this happen in 1.19 please üôå
Would love to see this happen. The allow/deny is much more common today and would be nice to see the effort put into changing this. Was surprised to see it not already changed.

And also add separate buttons for place block/use item, and destroy block/attack.

It would be so nice to play with...

It's odd that this feature doesn't exist. I can change the keyboard and mouse settings on my buttonless phone but I can't change controller settings in VR. At the very least, make it so that the "controller" rebinding doesn't pretend it's actually acknowledging your button presses. Not having a feature is one thing but straight-up lying in the user interface is just mean.
Friend xbox one and ps4
why is there only 1 vote plus me there should be a lot
same

i cant figure out a way to even get the original sounds from a texture pack! im pretty sure they used to have the old sounds when they had the original laucher (from what i remember) I dont get why they got rid of it. Maybe because they were sounds from a website :/

Eu queria isso no jogo
seeing it just in the inventory would also be fine with me. but please give us a way to know how long an effect is still lasting.
What do you mean by ‚Äúslidey‚Äù and ‚Äúfloaty‚Äù?

@Bilbo Baggins He means he dislikes the drifting in the java's flying. On console and bedrock when you let go of the keys you instantly stop moving. Also when descending on console and bedrock your speed stays constant
This has just happened with the PlayStation update V2.0. It really sucks. I want to revert back to the previous version.

I feel like there should be a setting in the options tabs, where you could either pick between drifting, gliding, whatever you want to call it, or just have it on  the non drift mode. I'm more used to the Java edition flying. There's not really anything wrong with it, honestly. Opinions are opinions, though, and you can try to prove me wrong that not drifting is better than drifting, but I'd prefer if Microsoft let's the individual players decide if they want Java flying or not

I agree with this. I simply don't understand how people play this version of minecraft. Because of this floaty movement, I just stick to the ps4 edition. The movement there is so much more responsive and I wish Mojang could just transfer that to the new minecraft.

I do not like the buttons to move. I would much prefer a joystick.
Unless I've missed something I think that a joystick option should be added. üëç
I completely agree with this. As an og MC player since 2014, as soon as I noticed this feature I hated it. It‚Äôs very weird to slide like your on ice.
Hey mojang can you add toggle sprint like in java in pocket edition when I'm in middle of a knock back in pvp I can't run away so please add it
Exactly, it's very annoying when building
Yes, this would make things much simpler. I really like this idea. Good thinking!

I agree, and I believe that this is already a feature on Bedrock, or at least it used to be.  It made flying much more fun with the ability to deactivate your wings on the way up, float, then reactivate them on the way down.  Now that potions of slow falling are a thing, it would also help with getting down from giant heights without having to wait ages.  It is so much easier to land on one block spaces with this feature, and it seems like a really minor change.  It just a tweak I think betters the gameplay without radically changing it.  As for what button, the jump button was what was used on bedrock.  Strangely, you could only use this while in survival.

At least the lack of fingers would limit the ability to make rude gestures. x3  I'm just not sure how it would work, especially in combination with non-VR players who wouldn't have the ability to gesture, let alone do customized gestures.
i agree like what vive craft did
NONVR

I would love to see more features come to vr! telescopes literally do NOTHING right now I have completely stopped playing Minecraft bedrock at this point because vr is practically unplayable, shaders are ruined, and the only time I still play is when my friends beg me to get on their worlds. Mojang should look at what vivecraft has accomplished natural locomotion (real swimming), great inventory, sword collision with mobs, and multiplayer arm movement. The community for java is outdoing the official devs for bedrock.
